title: Morrisons Checks Out Of Convenience Stores
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Sep 9, 2015, 14:42 BST - UK Markets close in 1 hr 48 mins Morrisons Checks Out Of Convenience Stores By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 5 minutes ago View Photo 

Morrisons is to sell its unprofitable convenience store portfolio at a loss of £30m as it looks to concentrate on its core stores. 
The company, which is due to announce its half-year results on Thursday, said it was shedding 140 M local convenience stores but would retain five of them as they were contained within either petrol stations or offered conversion opportunities. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) said that a team led by the retail entrepreneur Mike Greene was paying £25m in cash. 
Morrisons made the decision following a review of its convenience operation - a market it was very late to. 
The company said: "That review concluded that M local would have required significant further investment in new sites, plus additional capital expenditure and lease commitments, to reach profitability. 
"In the Board’s opinion, today’s sale announcement represents the best solution for Morrisons and will enable future Morrisons investment to be focused on core supermarkets." 
Morrisons said it expected to incur a loss on disposal of around £30m. 
David Potts, who took on the role of chief executive following the sacking of Dalton Philips earlier this year, said M Local was unable to scale. 
"We remain open to other opportunities in convenience in the future. I would like to thank all the Morrisons colleagues for their hard work and dedication to M local,” he said.
